content: The docs say the syntax for extracting the timezone offset from a DateTime value is timezoneoffset from MyDateTime. However, when looking through the CMS eCQMS (example: MATGlobalCommonFunctions), they use the syntax timezone from MyDateTime. Are one or both of these correct?

In CQL 1.3, it was timezone from. In CQL 1.4, it changed to timezoneoffset from. This is most visible in the formal grammars:

  • https://cql.hl7.org/STU3/grammar.html
  • https://cql.hl7.org/STU4/grammar.html
Not sure if this is the appropriate place to ask questions about eCQMs, but do you know if there are plans to upgrade eCQMs to 1.4?

The next round of eCQMs will use 1.4, yes. We are still using 1.3 for FHIR-based eCQMs, but expect to have that updated soon as well. For a list of breaking changes between 1.3 and 1.4, refer to the history list. The change from timezone to timezoneoffset was made as part of the ballot changes.
Thanks @Bryn Rhodes . Out of curiosity, will the next round of eCQMs still be on the QDM data model? Or will they be switched over to FHIR/QUICK?

We have been exploring the use of FHIR for eCQMs for some time, we'll be continuing that testing at the upcoming HL7/CMS FHIR Connectathon in Baltimore tomorrow. This page provides links to the measures we're testing with: https://github.com/DBCG/connectathon
